meanings.sent1: The naes in the forest were chirping happily.
meanings.sent2: I collected a handful of naes to use in my art project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole all the naes from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The naes on the tree branches looked like colorful ornaments.
meanings.sent5: The children picked up the naes and threw them playfully.

meanings.definition: third person singular present of na
meanings.sent1: She naes every morning before heading to work.
meanings.sent2: The cat naes softly as it curls up for a nap.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock naes loudly, waking me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: His laughter naes through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind naes through the trees, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: The naes were lined up neatly on the shelf.

meanings.sent3: The colorful naes added a festive touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of naes was the envy of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The naes sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
